page.title: 16FARMING
page.content: BECAUSE THE LAND IS SO GOOD FOR ARABLE FARMING, MOSTLY WINTER GRAIN, SOME OIL SEED RAPE, PEAS, POTATOES, TURNIPS AND GRASS FOR FATTENING CATTLE ARE GROWN. SOME GRAIN IS GROWN FOR SEED, ONE FARM HAVING A RETAIL SEED BUSINESS. LARGE SILOS OF SILAGE TOWER ABOVE THE FARMS. CATTLE ARE BOUGHT AND SOLD EITHER PRIVATELY OR AT BERWICK OR RESTON MARKET. ONE FARM HAS 100 DAIRY COWS WHICH PRODUCE 500,000 LITRES OF MILK PER YEAR. THE FARMS USE VERY MODERN EQUIPMENT. ONE TO THREE MEN AND A STUDENT, WITH THE HELP OF TRACTORRS, COMBINES, COMPUTERS TO COUNT MILK YIELDS, CONTROL CATTLE FEED AND KEEP FARM YIELDS, ETC. FILED, CAN RUN A FARM WHICH USED TO NEED MANY WORKERS - LAND ARMY AND PRISONERS OF WAR - IN THE FIELDS.
